unnormalised: IT dept. sources confirm that the deadline for filing ITR for AY 2024-25 has been extended to 31/08/2024. This comes as a relief to many taxpayers, especially small business owners and salaried individuals, who were struggling to meet the original deadline of 31/07/2024. The extension is largely attributed to the ongoing glitches on the incometax.gov.in portal, as pointed out by several tax consultants like CA. R.K. Agarwal.
normalised: I-T department sources confirm that the deadline for filing I-T-R for A-Y two thousand twenty four to twenty five has been extended to thirty first august two thousand twenty four. This comes as a relief to many taxpayers, especially small business owners and salaried individuals, who were struggling to meet the original deadline of thirty first july two thousand twenty four. The extension is largely attributed to the ongoing glitches on the incometax dot gov dot in portal, as pointed out by several tax consultants like C-A R-K Agarwal.

unnormalised: "We understand the challenges faced by taxpayers," stated a senior official. "The extension allows ample time for everyone to comply. We urge all taxpayers to file their returns well before the revised deadline to avoid any last-minute rush. Please ensure all your details, including PAN and Aadhaar, are correctly entered to avoid processing delays." Reports indicate approx. 2 crore returns have already been filed.

unnormalised: The extension is also expected to benefit those claiming deductions under Section 80C, 80D, and other sections of the Income Tax Act. Individuals should make sure that their investments and expenses are properly documented to claim these benefits. Remember, tax evasion can lead to penalties and legal action, as per Section 271 of the IT Act.
